Figure Caption: Dependence of the true flow stress on true strain during cold rolling (solid circles) and compression (blue solid line) tests of the HfNbTaTiZr alloy. (For interpretation of the references to colour in this figure legend, the reader is referred to the web version of this article.)

Microhardness of as-cold-rolled and rolled-and-annealed sheets of HfNbTaTiZr: (a) 65% thickness reduction and (b) 86.4% thickness reduction. The microhardness was measured on the longitudinal cross-section of sheets along the normal direction. The position 0 mm corresponds to the sheet surface.
True stress –true strain curves of as-cold-rolled and rolled-and-annealed sheet of HfNbTaTiZr.
X-ray diffraction patterns for HfNbTaTiZr: (a) After 86.4% total reduction and following annealing for 2 h at: (b) 800 °C or (c) 1000 °C.
SEM backscatter images from a longitudinal cross-section of HfNbTaTiZr sheet after 65% cold-reduction showing (a) heavily-deformed grains and (b) deformation bands inside the grains.

EBSD results for HfNbTaTiZr sheet following a 65% thickness reduction: (a) Image-quality map and (b) inverse-pole-figure map for the transverse direction. Longitudinal cross-section; the rolling direction is horizontal.

EBSD results for HfNbTaTiZr sheet following an 86.4% thickness reduction: (a) Image-quality map and (b) inverse-pole-figure map for the transverse direction. Longitudinal cross-section; the rolling direction is horizontal.
Inverse pole figures for the normal (ND), rolling (RD) and transverse (TD) directions of sheets whose total thickness reduction was (a) 65% or (b) 86.4%.

SEM backscatter images of the longitudinal cross-section of HfNbTaTiZr sheet after 65% thickness reduction and annealing at 800 °C for 2 h: (a) Low magnification image showing partially-recrystallized structure consisting of large, heavily-deformed grains and fine, equiaxed, recrystallized grains. (b) Higher magnification image showing fine second-phase particles precipitated along deformation bands in non-recrystallized grains. The rolling direction is horizontal.

SEM backscatter images of the longitudinal cross-section of HfNbTaTiZr sheet after 86.4% thickness reduction and annealing at 800 °C for 2 h: (a) Low magnification image showing partially-recrystallized structure consisting of large, heavily-deformed grains and fine, equiaxed, recrystallized grains. (b) Higher magnification image showing fine second-phase particles precipitated along deformation bands in non-recrystallized grains. The rolling direction is horizontal.

EBSD images of the longitudinal cross-section of the 86.4% cold rolled sheet of HfNbTaTiZr alloy after annealing at 800 °C for 2 h: (a, b) inverse-pole-figure maps of grains for the (a) transverse and (b) normal directions of the sheet and (c) image quality map. The rolling direction is horizontal. The color-coded IPF triangle of crystal orientations is given inFig. 6.
SEM backscatter images of the longitudinal cross-section of (a) 65% and (b) 86.4% cold-reduced sheets of HfNbTaTiZr after annealing at 1000 °C for 2 h. The rolling direction is horizontal.

EBSD data from a longitudinal cross-section of HfNbTaTiZr sheet after 86.4% thickness reduction and annealing at 1000 °C for 2 h: (a) inverse-pole-figure map for the transverse direction and (b) image-quality map with superimposed grain-boundary misorientations (>10°, blue color). The rolling direction is horizontal. (For interpretation of the references to colour in this figure legend, the reader is referred to the web version of this article.)

SEM backscatter images of the longitudinal cross-section of (a) 65% and (b) 86.4% cold-reduced sheets of HfNbTaTiZr after annealing at 1200 °C for 2 h. (c) Precipitates observed inside recrystallized grains and at grain boundaries. (d) Typical morphology of the precipitate particles. The rolling direction is horizontal.
Inverse pole figures for the normal (ND), rolling (RD), and transverse (TD) directions of sheet after 86.4% thickness reduction and annealing for 2 h at: (a) 800 °C, (b) 1000 °C, or (c) 1200 °C.

SEM images at various magnifications of the fracture surface of an 86% cold-reduced sheet of HfNbTaTiZr that was tension tested to failure at room temperature. The sheet transverse direction is horizontal, and the normal direction is vertical in each image.

SEM images of different areas of the fracture surface of an 86.4% cold-reduced sheet of HfNbTaTiZr that was tension tested to failure at room temperature after annealing at 800 °C for 2 h: (a) Blocky appearance at a low magnification, (b) a heavily-deformed area with large dimples, and (c, d) an adjacent area with fine, shallow dimples at different magnifications. The sheet transverse direction is horizontal, and the normal direction is vertical in each image.

SEM images of different areas of the fracture surface of an 86.4% cold-rolled sheet of HfNbTaTiZr that was tension tested to failure at room temperature after annealing at 1000 °C for 2 h: (a) Mainly intergranular fracture along grain boundaries of recrystallized grains, (b–d) higher magnification images showing a mixed mode of failure, ductile (intergranular and transgranular) and intergranular cleavage. The sheet transverse direction is horizontal, and the normal direction is vertical in each image.

True strain vs. true stress curves obtained during compression testing of a cast plus annealed (at 1200 °C for 24 h) specimen (solid line) and during tension testing of cold rolled plus annealed (at 1000 °C for 2 h) specimen (black dotted line) of HfNbTaTiZr. Orange dotted line is the same tensile curve shifted to the right by Δε = 0.04. (For interpretation of the references to colour in this figure legend, the reader is referred to the web version of this article.)
